intro: Centrostigma papillosum, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is native to regions of Central and South America and thrives in warm, humid climates. Its hairy, velvety leaves give it its common name, and it is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. The plant is also known for its ability to produce a large number of seeds, contributing to its invasive potential in some areas.
